title: DNCC files case over attack on officials at Mirpur
body: A case has been filed in connection with the attack on the officials of Dhaka North City Corporation during an eviction drive in the capital’s Mirpur-1 on December 9. DNCC surveyor Md Taslim Hossain filed the case with Shah Ali police in Mirpur on Thursday night, naming 31 individuals and 200–250 unidentified people. Citing the case statement, a DNCC release said that at about 1:50pm on December 9, an eviction drive was carried out under the leadership of DNCC executive magistrate Marufa Begum Neli to free Shaheed Minar, playground, footpath and road in the area from illegal occupation. During the drive, a group of 200–250 people attacked the DNCC team with iron rods and bamboo sticks and hurled bricks and stones at the officials. Several DNCC staffs, including three drivers, were injured in the incident. The attackers also obstructed government work and launched an attack on the executive magistrate’s team with the intent to kill, the case statement added. The group vandalised DNCC vehicles, causing a damage of Tk 13.80 lakh. The case statement further mentioned that filing of the case was delayed as time was needed to treat the injured and collect the names and addresses of the attackers.
